alert.note: Alert for Coastal Collier County; Coastal Miami Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued June 03 at 10:53AM EDT until June 05 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 11 PM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Collier and Coastal Miami-Dade Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 2 AM to 11 PM EDT Saturday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Collier County; Coastal Miami Dade County
